favourite.article: Good song. Can I get the Yoruba translation?
Beautiful hymn, so inspiring; surely enjoyed the service in Leeds UK today....

To Mary from Hamilton, Ontario—my mother always tagged it with 494, according to her Irish father's hymn book from Belfast. She loved to hear him, a great tenor, sing it back in "the day" (she'll be 100 next week!) Good day!

I so love this song. At my church growing up it was filled with military families.The last service before they deployed we would sing this song. It was 8 years before they were playing it for my family. Thank you Rockville Bethal Bible Church and Paster Raube for all the wonderful memories and the firm foundation you helped build in my life.

What a beautiful hymn for funerals. Indeed we shall meet again at the feet of Jesus Christ our Lord and Savior. Even if we do not understand the Holy Bible but put our hope and trust in Him it is Gods promise that we shall meet again.
For Mary from Canada - it's number 65 or 66, there's two. Sorry but you might recognise the music.
During WW2 my family always added the hymn number for this hymn "God be with you till we meet again". Can you tell me what this number is, or where I might find this info? Thank you.
This song gives hope to me that I will see my parents again. Faith, friends, is important. This is my faith to God, the Lord. Yes, my Jesus Christ. See again! Yes see again! Amen.
This song touches my heart and we sing it at our Alzheimer's day care which really makes the words precious.
Life is short and suddenly death separate us from our loves one but this hymn remind us of the hope that we have in Jesus Christ. Yes, "till we meet at Jesus' feet."
I really love this song which reminds of the Lord's concern for His children and the hope we have in Him.

God be with you till we meet again was a popular song sang in Ibo laguage-southeast Nigeria-during burial ceremonies. It was a grave hymn so to speak. That was when I was a child chorister. But now I feel it should be a family song, to be sang as the family rises in the morning to go about their various chores; work, school etc. How meaningful.
